info.headline: Flood Advisory issued November 20 at 3:34PM CST until November 20 at 5:30PM CST by NWS San Angelo TX
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of west central Texas, including the following counties, Brown, much of Coleman and McCulloch Counties.
* WHEN...Until 530 PM CST.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 328 PM CST, radar indicated numerous showers with a few thunderstorms across Brown, Coleman and McCulloch Counties. Occasional moderate and briefly heavy rain will result in localized minor flooding of low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some street flooding could occur in Brownwood and Brady. Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Brownwood, Brady, Coleman, Early, Santa Anna, Bangs, Blanket, Melvin, Trickham, Brookesmith, Lake Brownwood, Lake Brownwood Near Thrifty, Winchell, Rockwood, Grosvenor, Mercury, Camp Bowie, Gouldbusk, Lake Brownwood State Park and Waldrip. - This includes the following Low Water Crossings... Good Shephard at 11th, Austin Street at Avenue G, Magnolia at Belmeade, Cordell at Anderson, Gifford at Beaver, Indian Creek at 9th, 4th Street at Wood, Willis at Belmeade, Belle Plain at Romines and Austin Street at Avenue J. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM CST THIS AFTERNOON

area.areaDesc: Brown, TX; Coleman, TX; McCulloch, TX
